title: Introducing Mint Funds Recap Series - Batch 01
body:
On February 28th, we unveiled our first 35 artists. After two weeks of onboarding, planning, and networking, we knew it was time to mint. We instituted the “Round” method of minting works in groups every Wednesday and Saturday. To date, 14 of those artists have successfully minted and released their first NFTs out into the world. This post serves as a highlight and reference to memorialize the group that started it all.


**Key Stats**

14 Artists
From Argentina to Indonesia (Representing 6 Countries)
2 Workshops (Featuring Cooper Turley and Osinachi)
2 Weeks
4 Rounds

**Artists**

✺ [Eddington Again](https://twitter.com/eddingtonagain)
✺ [Tondji](https://twitter.com/t0ndji)
✺ [Cy Tone](https://twitter.com/cy_tone)
✺ [Kenneth Lartey](https://twitter.com/knnylrty)
✺ [Rimbawan Gerilya](https://twitter.com/RIMBAWANGERILYA)
✺ [Ravi Vasavan](https://twitter.com/ravivasavan) 
✺ [Niall Ashley](https://twitter.com/niallashley_)
✺ [Sky Kawano](https://twitter.com/skykawano)
✺ [Tigris](https://twitter.com/tigrisli)
✺ [Baran Acar](https://twitter.com/_acarimo)
✺ [Ikaro Cavalcante](https://twitter.com/occult3d)
✺ [Magdalena Molinari](https://twitter.com/maggiemolinari)
✺ [Christopher de la Guardia / Dela](https://twitter.com/artofdela)
✺ [Ben Makgetlane](https://twitter.com/benmakgetlane)

## What We Learned

During the onboarding process, We recognized a few things:

> Not everyone's NFT will sell immediately;
> Artists need more than just one stipend to mint creative works;
> Not every artist will mint in a specific timeframe.

To accommodate this, and to celebrate all of our artists, we are experimenting with **$RECAP NFTs** — a special 1/1 gif that cycles through the artwork of our batch groups that will be auctioned off with the proceeds being split among each artist of that batch group, $BOUNTY holders, $BOUNTY NFT Auction winner and Mint Fund DAO (a total of 47 recipients).

To do this, we are deploying Mint Fund's crowdfunded Reserve Auction ($BOUNTY), and using Mirror recently introduced SPLITS Auction feature. 

[](https://mint.mirror.xyz/mDws2xGmJCq55ehGDdcv8tGDCpSd_c_CfeqhexiKSqU)

**Split Allocation**

14 Batch 01 Artists / 80%
31 $BOUNTY Holders / 10%
$BOUNTY NFT Auction Winner / 5%
MintFund DAO / 5%

*The Final distribution percentage was rounded for simplicity. A full breakdown of the Batch 01 Split allocations can be found [here.](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1TurnDk8wuCgNA2FYY0PeJGV0cQ2TiZloxkGz-32T9xc/edit?usp=sharing)*

We believe in redistribution at every level, and with our $RECAP series, we can ensure that artists can earn ETH so they can continue minting.

[Token #3051](auction://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7?network=mainnet&tokenId=3051)

---

## The Mints
### Round One

**FIRST MINT ✺**
Vocalist and composer from Los Angeles, [Eddington Again](https://twitter.com/eddingtonagain) style ranges from classic soul, R&B bops, to experimental pop. 
**Petrify:** A visual collaboration with 011668. Sounds co-produced with Otxoa and Jerry Andrews.

[NFT](ethereum://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7/1790)


**SECOND MINT ✺**
Deaf artist and designer, [Ravi Vasavan](https://twitter.com/ravivasavan) lives, bakes, bikes, camps, sings, and loves in London.
**Ficus 1/3:** After experiencing birth, existence, and death up-close, this work is reminder that we are in a constant state of rebirth.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/8135)


**THIRD MINT ✺**
[Kenneth Lartey](https://twitter.com/knnylrty) is a filmmaker and DJ. 
**Some Friend You Are:** An unreleased work designed for legendary underground DMV artist Sir EU, originally used for one of his musical projects.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/9415)

**FOURTH MINT ✺**
[Cy Tone](https://twitter.com/cy_tone)
**DISORDER:** Inhale / Exhale / Inspire / Create
"All Content is Copyright-free, everyone can use it as he/she/they prefer, we don't give a [ˈfʌk]. Culture is a human heritage not a mass production tool."
“test, experiments, results”

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/9286)



**FIFTH MINT ✺**
Beninese 3D artist, [Tondji](https://twitter.com/t0ndji) style mixes Afrofuturism and conceptual art. 
**Na Hangbé:** Tondji tells the story of Tassi Hangbé, the queen of the kingdom of Dahomey. Her history will not go untold any longer.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/10040)

**SIXTH MINT ✺**
[Rimbawan Gerilya](https://twitter.com/RIMBAWANGERILYA) is a visual artist and VJ from S.E.Asia working mostly with the music scene.
**GMO Utility Trike:** In 2020, Gabber Modus Operandi live gigs were cancelled. They brought the party to the masses through cyberspace with the help of Siko Setyanto, a dancer, and Rimbawan Gerilya, an animator.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/9501)


---

### Round Two

**FIRST MINT ✺**
[Niall Ashley](https://twitter.com/niallashley_) is a self-taught painter from Bristol, England.
**G-check:** A depiction of roadmen in a non-binary context, questioning how we assume gender and overt masculinity.

[NFT](ethereum://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7/2335)

**SECOND MINT ✺**
[Tigris](https://twitter.com/tigrisli) is 3D Motion Designer & Creative Technologist exploring emotional intelligence and biometrics.
Curves as Deep as the Ocean: unveils the depth of waves that uncover serenity and peace within one’s body of the ocean.

[NFT](ethereum://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7/1083)

**THIRD MINT ✺**
Japanese/British artist [Sky Kawano](https://twitter.com/skykawano) specializes in mixed-media motion that captures chaos and ephemerality.
**TENACITY OF LIFE:** A mixed-media digital poster inspired by the tenacity of ants as aspirational spirit animals.

[NFT](ethereum://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7/1486)



---

### Round Three

**FIRST MINT ✺**
[Ikaro Cavalcante](https://twitter.com/occult3d) is a Brazilian Artist focused on CGI and Artmedia.
**Flowers of non-death:** is the artists genesis piece and the first work in the "Blood Connection" series of three pieces.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/13288)

**SECOND MINT ✺**
[Baran Acar](https://twitter.com/_acarimo) is a digital artist and student based in Eskisehir, Turkey.
**Caution:** 3D illustration. 3000x3750

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/12553)

---

### Round Four

**FIRST MINT ✺**
[Magdalena Molinari](https://twitter.com/maggiemolinari) is an Argentinian architect and artist. 
**"IRIS N1"** - A series of abstract video pieces where the colors from the sky and the circular movements are combined to create "skylike" sensations.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/19025)


**SECOND MINT ✺**
[Christopher de la Guardia / Dela](https://twitter.com/artofdela) is an artist based out of Miami, Florida
**"Beauty In Destruction"** is about getting rid of the old world and creating a new one. We are on the cusp of digital freedom.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/18369)


**THIRD MINT ✺**
[Ben Makgetlane](https://twitter.com/benmakgetlane) is a minimalist illustrator & graphic designer based in Pretoria, South Africa.
**Take Care:**  "Part of a series where i reimagine some of my favorite album covers using my minimalist illustration style".

https://rarible.com/token/0xd07dc4262bcdbf85190c01c996b4c06a461d2430:442193:0x1c9fefb363361b303f9ab3cb08395cf863461784 




---

## What’s Next?

Get familiar with the MintFund artist community by joining our discord, or following us on twitter. We are in the process of minting our second batch of artists and currently curating our third and fourth groups. We are actively looking for community moderators in multiple timezones, efforts in localizing resources in most common languages, and programming for our growing artist body. 

**MINT FUND NFT GALLERY + CURATION SPACE**
As we work with each creator to mint their first NFTs, we’ll be adding their work to our site. This is a space to nurture and highlight the artists we work with. A place to give them all some extra shine. In addition, we will enable auctions using the $BOUNTY auction method to help our artists sell their first NFTs. This also grants curators an opportunity to submit works for MintFund $BOUNTY holders to collect a % of the auction fee from curated sales.

Stay tuned. SOON™


## About MintFund

MintFund is a community project created with the sole purpose to build a support network for artists interested in bringing their art into the world of [NFTs](https://linda.mirror.xyz/df649d61efb92c910464a4e74ae213c4cab150b9cbcc4b7fb6090fc77881a95d)/[cryptomedia](https://cryptomedia.wtf/).

MintFund provides artists with the funds to mint NFTs (known as gas costs), and offers guidance, mentorship and advice for the growing community of cryptomedia artists. MintFund is accessible to all artists and we prioritize BIPOC and LGTBQIA+ artists, especially outside of North America and the European Union.

[NFT](ethereum://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7/2335)

**SECOND MINT ✺**
[Tigris](https://twitter.com/tigrisli) is 3D Motion Designer & Creative Technologist exploring emotional intelligence and biometrics.
Curves as Deep as the Ocean: unveils the depth of waves that uncover serenity and peace within one’s body of the ocean.

[NFT](ethereum://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7/1083)

**THIRD MINT ✺**
Japanese/British artist [Sky Kawano](https://twitter.com/skykawano) specializes in mixed-media motion that captures chaos and ephemerality.
**TENACITY OF LIFE:** A mixed-media digital poster inspired by the tenacity of ants as aspirational spirit animals.

[NFT](ethereum://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7/1486)



---

### Round Three

**FIRST MINT ✺**
[Ikaro Cavalcante](https://twitter.com/occult3d) is a Brazilian Artist focused on CGI and Artmedia.
**Flowers of non-death:** is the artists genesis piece and the first work in the "Blood Connection" series of three pieces.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/13288)

**SECOND MINT ✺**
[Baran Acar](https://twitter.com/_acarimo) is a digital artist and student based in Eskisehir, Turkey.
**Caution:** 3D illustration. 3000x3750

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/12553)

---

### Round Four

**FIRST MINT ✺**
[Magdalena Molinari](https://twitter.com/maggiemolinari) is an Argentinian architect and artist. 
**"IRIS N1"** - A series of abstract video pieces where the colors from the sky and the circular movements are combined to create "skylike" sensations.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/19025)


**SECOND MINT ✺**
[Christopher de la Guardia / Dela](https://twitter.com/artofdela) is an artist based out of Miami, Florida
**"Beauty In Destruction"** is about getting rid of the old world and creating a new one. We are on the cusp of digital freedom.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/18369)


**THIRD MINT ✺**
[Ben Makgetlane](https://twitter.com/benmakgetlane) is a minimalist illustrator & graphic designer based in Pretoria, South Africa.
**Take Care:**  "Part of a series where i reimagine some of my favorite album covers using my minimalist illustration style".

https://rarible.com/token/0xd07dc4262bcdbf85190c01c996b4c06a461d2430:442193:0x1c9fefb363361b303f9ab3cb08395cf863461784 




---

## What’s Next?

Get familiar with the MintFund artist community by joining our discord, or following us on twitter. We are in the process of minting our second batch of artists and currently curating our third and fourth groups. We are actively looking for community moderators in multiple timezones, efforts in localizing resources in most common languages, and programming for our growing artist body. 

**MINT FUND NFT GALLERY + CURATION SPACE**
As we work with each creator to mint their first NFTs, we’ll be adding their work to our site. This is a space to nurture and highlight the artists we work with. A place to give them all some extra shine. In addition, we will enable auctions using the $BOUNTY auction method to help our artists sell their first NFTs. This also grants curators an opportunity to submit works for MintFund $BOUNTY holders to collect a % of the auction fee from curated sales.

Stay tuned. SOON™


## About MintFund

MintFund is a community project created with the sole purpose to build a support network for artists interested in bringing their art into the world of [NFTs](https://linda.mirror.xyz/df649d61efb92c910464a4e74ae213c4cab150b9cbcc4b7fb6090fc77881a95d)/[cryptomedia](https://cryptomedia.wtf/).

[MintFund](http://themint.fund/) provides artists with the funds to mint NFTs (known as gas costs), and offers guidance, mentorship and advice for the growing community of cryptomedia artists. MintFund is accessible to all artists and we prioritize BIPOC and LGTBQIA+ artists, especially outside of North America and the European Union.

title: Introducing Mint Funds Recap Series - Batch 01 + NFT Auction
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ea3bfd2e-9595-4008-b3ea-731af016e9a4.jpg?height=721&width=1281)

On February 28th, we [unveiled](https://twitter.com/themintfund/status/1365813777929756674) our first 35 artists. After two weeks of onboarding, planning, and networking, we knew it was time to mint. We instituted the “Round” method of minting works in groups every Wednesday and Saturday. To date, 14 of those artists have successfully minted and released their first NFTs out into the world. This post serves as a highlight and reference to memorialize the group that started it all.


**Key Stats**

14 Artists
From Argentina to Indonesia (Representing 6 Countries)
2 Workshops (Featuring Cooper Turley and Osinachi)
2 Weeks
4 Rounds

**Artists**

✺ [Eddington Again](https://twitter.com/eddingtonagain)
✺ [Tondji](https://twitter.com/t0ndji)
✺ [Cy Tone](https://twitter.com/cy_tone)
✺ [Kenneth Lartey](https://twitter.com/knnylrty)
✺ [Rimbawan Gerilya](https://twitter.com/RIMBAWANGERILYA)
✺ [Ravi Vasavan](https://twitter.com/ravivasavan) 
✺ [Niall Ashley](https://twitter.com/niallashley_)
✺ [Sky Kawano](https://twitter.com/skykawano)
✺ [Tigris](https://twitter.com/tigrisli)
✺ [Baran Acar](https://twitter.com/_acarimo)
✺ [Ikaro Cavalcante](https://twitter.com/occult3d)
✺ [Magdalena Molinari](https://twitter.com/maggiemolinari)
✺ [Christopher de la Guardia / Dela](https://twitter.com/artofdela)
✺ [Ben Makgetlane](https://twitter.com/benmakgetlane)

## What We Learned

During the onboarding & minting process, We recognized a few things:

> Not everyone's NFT will sell immediately;
> Artists need more than just one stipend to mint creative works;
> Not every artist will mint in a specific timeframe.

To accommodate this, and to celebrate all of our artists, we are experimenting with **$RECAP NFTs** — a special 1/1 gif that cycles through the artwork of our batch groups that will be auctioned off with the proceeds being split among each artist of that batch group, $BOUNTY holders, $BOUNTY NFT Auction Winner and Mint Fund DAO (a total of 47 recipients).

To do this, we are deploying Mint Fund's crowdfunded [Reserve Auction ($BOUNTY)](https://mint.mirror.xyz/mDws2xGmJCq55ehGDdcv8tGDCpSd_c_CfeqhexiKSqU), and using Mirror recently introduced Splits Auction feature. 

We believe in redistribution at every level, and with our $RECAP series, we can ensure that artists can earn ETH so they can continue minting.

[Token #3051](auction://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7?network=mainnet&tokenId=3051)

**Split Allocation**

14 Batch 01 Artists / 80%
31 $BOUNTY Holders / 10%
$BOUNTY NFT Auction Winner / 5%
MintFund DAO / 5%

*The Final distribution percentage was rounded for simplicity. A full breakdown of the Batch 01 Split allocations can be found [here.](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1TurnDk8wuCgNA2FYY0PeJGV0cQ2TiZloxkGz-32T9xc/edit?usp=sharing)*

---

## The Mints
### Round One

**FIRST MINT ✺**
Vocalist and composer from Los Angeles, [Eddington Again](https://twitter.com/eddingtonagain) style ranges from classic soul, R&B bops, to experimental pop. 
**Petrify:** A visual collaboration with 011668. Sounds co-produced with Otxoa and Jerry Andrews.

[NFT](ethereum://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7/1790)


**SECOND MINT ✺**
Deaf artist and designer, [Ravi Vasavan](https://twitter.com/ravivasavan) lives, bakes, bikes, camps, sings, and loves in London.
**Ficus 1/3:** After experiencing birth, existence, and death up-close, this work is reminder that we are in a constant state of rebirth.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/8135)


**THIRD MINT ✺**
[Kenneth Lartey](https://twitter.com/knnylrty) is a filmmaker and DJ. 
**Some Friend You Are:** An unreleased work designed for legendary underground DMV artist Sir EU, originally used for one of his musical projects.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/9415)

**FOURTH MINT ✺**
[Cy Tone](https://twitter.com/cy_tone)
**DISORDER:** Inhale / Exhale / Inspire / Create
"All Content is Copyright-free, everyone can use it as he/she/they prefer, we don't give a [ˈfʌk]. Culture is a human heritage not a mass production tool."
“test, experiments, results”

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/9286)



**FIFTH MINT ✺**
Beninese 3D artist, [Tondji](https://twitter.com/t0ndji) style mixes Afrofuturism and conceptual art. 
**Na Hangbé:** Tondji tells the story of Tassi Hangbé, the queen of the kingdom of Dahomey. Her history will not go untold any longer.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/10040)

**SIXTH MINT ✺**
[Rimbawan Gerilya](https://twitter.com/RIMBAWANGERILYA) is a visual artist and VJ from S.E.Asia working mostly with the music scene.
**GMO Utility Trike:** In 2020, Gabber Modus Operandi live gigs were cancelled. They brought the party to the masses through cyberspace with the help of Siko Setyanto, a dancer, and Rimbawan Gerilya, an animator.

✺ [Ravi Vasavan](https://twitter.com/ravivasavan) 
✺ [Niall Ashley](https://twitter.com/niallashley_)
✺ [Sky Kawano](https://twitter.com/skykawano)
✺ [Tigris](https://twitter.com/tigrisli)
✺ [Baran Acar](https://twitter.com/_acarimo)
✺ [Ikaro Cavalcante](https://twitter.com/occult3d)
✺ [Magdalena Molinari](https://twitter.com/maggiemolinari)
✺ [Christopher de la Guardia / Dela](https://twitter.com/artofdela)
✺ [Ben Makgetlane](https://twitter.com/benmakgetlane)

## What We Learned

During the onboarding & minting process, We recognized a few things:

> Not everyone's NFT will sell immediately;
> Artists need more than just one stipend to mint creative works;
> Not every artist will mint in a specific timeframe.

To accommodate this, and to celebrate all of our artists, we are experimenting with **$RECAP NFTs** — a special 1/1 gif that cycles through the artwork of our batch groups that will be auctioned off with the proceeds being split among each artist of that batch group, $BOUNTY holders, $BOUNTY NFT Auction Winner and Mint Fund DAO (a total of 47 recipients).

To do this, we are deploying Mint Fund's crowdfunded [Reserve Auction ($BOUNTY)](https://mint.mirror.xyz/mDws2xGmJCq55ehGDdcv8tGDCpSd_c_CfeqhexiKSqU), and using Mirror recently introduced Splits Auction feature. 

We believe in redistribution at every level, and with our $RECAP series, we can ensure that artists can earn ETH so they can continue minting.

[Token #3051](auction://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7?network=mainnet&tokenId=3051)

**Split Allocation**

14 Batch 01 Artists / 80%
31 $BOUNTY Holders / 10%
$BOUNTY NFT Auction Winner / 5%
MintFund DAO / 5%

*The Final distribution percentage was rounded for simplicity. A full breakdown of the Batch 01 Split allocations can be found [here.](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1TurnDk8wuCgNA2FYY0PeJGV0cQ2TiZloxkGz-32T9xc/edit?usp=sharing)*

---

## The Mints
### Round One

**FIRST MINT ✺**
Vocalist and composer from Los Angeles, [Eddington Again](https://twitter.com/eddingtonagain) style ranges from classic soul, R&B bops, to experimental pop. 
**Petrify:** A visual collaboration with 011668. Sounds co-produced with Otxoa and Jerry Andrews.

[NFT](ethereum://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7/1790)


**SECOND MINT ✺**
Deaf artist and designer, [Ravi Vasavan](https://twitter.com/ravivasavan) lives, bakes, bikes, camps, sings, and loves in London.
**Ficus 1/3:** After experiencing birth, existence, and death up-close, this work is reminder that we are in a constant state of rebirth.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/8135)


**THIRD MINT ✺**
[Kenneth Lartey](https://twitter.com/knnylrty) is a filmmaker and DJ. 
**Some Friend You Are:** An unreleased work designed for legendary underground DMV artist Sir EU, originally used for one of his musical projects.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/9415)

**FOURTH MINT ✺**
[Cy Tone](https://twitter.com/cy_tone)
**DISORDER:** Inhale / Exhale / Inspire / Create
"All Content is Copyright-free, everyone can use it as he/she/they prefer, we don't give a [ˈfʌk]. Culture is a human heritage not a mass production tool."
“test, experiments, results”

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/9286)



**FIFTH MINT ✺**
Beninese 3D artist, [Tondji](https://twitter.com/t0ndji) style mixes Afrofuturism and conceptual art. 
**Na Hangbé:** Tondji tells the story of Tassi Hangbé, the queen of the kingdom of Dahomey. Her history will not go untold any longer.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/10040)

**SIXTH MINT ✺**
[Rimbawan Gerilya](https://twitter.com/RIMBAWANGERILYA) is a visual artist and VJ from S.E.Asia working mostly with the music scene.
**GMO Utility Trike:** In 2020, Gabber Modus Operandi live gigs were cancelled. They brought the party to the masses through cyberspace with the help of Siko Setyanto, a dancer, and Rimbawan Gerilya, an animator.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/9501)


---

### Round Two

**FIRST MINT ✺**
[Niall Ashley](https://twitter.com/niallashley_) is a self-taught painter from Bristol, England.
**G-check:** A depiction of roadmen in a non-binary context, questioning how we assume gender and overt masculinity.

[NFT](ethereum://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7/2335)

**SECOND MINT ✺**
[Tigris](https://twitter.com/tigrisli) is 3D Motion Designer & Creative Technologist exploring emotional intelligence and biometrics.
Curves as Deep as the Ocean: unveils the depth of waves that uncover serenity and peace within one’s body of the ocean.

[NFT](ethereum://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7/1083)

**THIRD MINT ✺**
Japanese/British artist [Sky Kawano](https://twitter.com/skykawano) specializes in mixed-media motion that captures chaos and ephemerality.
**TENACITY OF LIFE:** A mixed-media digital poster inspired by the tenacity of ants as aspirational spirit animals.

[NFT](ethereum://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7/1486)



---

### Round Three

**FIRST MINT ✺**
[Ikaro Cavalcante](https://twitter.com/occult3d) is a Brazilian Artist focused on CGI and Artmedia.
**Flowers of non-death:** is the artists genesis piece and the first work in the "Blood Connection" series of three pieces.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/13288)

**SECOND MINT ✺**
[Baran Acar](https://twitter.com/_acarimo) is a digital artist and student based in Eskisehir, Turkey.
**Caution:** 3D illustration. 3000x3750

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/12553)

---

### Round Four

**FIRST MINT ✺**
[Magdalena Molinari](https://twitter.com/maggiemolinari) is an Argentinian architect and artist. 
**"IRIS N1"** - A series of abstract video pieces where the colors from the sky and the circular movements are combined to create "skylike" sensations.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/19025)


**SECOND MINT ✺**
[Christopher de la Guardia / Dela](https://twitter.com/artofdela) is an artist based out of Miami, Florida
**"Beauty In Destruction"** is about getting rid of the old world and creating a new one. We are on the cusp of digital freedom.

[NFT](ethereum://0x3B3ee1931Dc30C1957379FAc9aba94D1C48a5405/18369)


**THIRD MINT ✺**
[Ben Makgetlane](https://twitter.com/benmakgetlane) is a minimalist illustrator & graphic designer based in Pretoria, South Africa.
**Take Care:**  "Part of a series where i reimagine some of my favorite album covers using my minimalist illustration style".

https://rarible.com/token/0xd07dc4262bcdbf85190c01c996b4c06a461d2430:442193:0x1c9fefb363361b303f9ab3cb08395cf863461784 




---

## What’s Next?

Get familiar with the MintFund artist community by joining our discord, or following us on twitter. We are in the process of minting our second batch of artists and currently curating our third and fourth groups. We are actively looking for community moderators in multiple timezones, efforts in localizing resources in most common languages, and programming for our growing artist body. 

**MINT FUND NFT GALLERY + CURATION SPACE**
As we work with each creator to mint their first NFTs, we’ll be adding their work to our site. This is a space to nurture and highlight the artists we work with. A place to give them all some extra shine. In addition, we will enable auctions using the $BOUNTY auction method to help our artists sell their first NFTs. This also grants curators an opportunity to submit works for MintFund $BOUNTY holders to collect a % of the auction fee from curated sales.

Stay tuned. SOON™


## About MintFund

MintFund is a community project created with the sole purpose to build a support network for artists interested in bringing their art into the world of [NFTs](https://linda.mirror.xyz/df649d61efb92c910464a4e74ae213c4cab150b9cbcc4b7fb6090fc77881a95d)/[cryptomedia](https://cryptomedia.wtf/).

[MintFund](http://themint.fund/) provides artists with the funds to mint NFTs (known as gas costs), and offers guidance, mentorship and advice for the growing community of cryptomedia artists. MintFund is accessible to all artists and we prioritize BIPOC and LGTBQIA+ artists, especially outside of North America and the European Union.

title: Cope Launch
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/105a907c-2997-4ac9-822b-5d0614c8dfb2.jpg?height=2200&width=3800)


We model the future from scratch. When we make assumptions, we state them. Otherwise, we presume that the future could unfold in many directions.

We methodically piece together plausible scenarios, step by step, using systems theory and applied mathematics. We compile our findings in detailed reports, and release them for small sums. We like to explore questions that have not been asked, including questions that are controversial, heterodox, or untoward:

- How can we design a feasible incentive structure for carbon sequestration that reduces moral hazard?
- What might graph theory tell us about behavior on an entirely unindexed internet?
- Is the term “Blackrock Communism” the most accurate descriptor for America’s political economy?



Feedback from our supporters is vital to the process. We imagine this as a new forum for future thought – research for the hive. Supporters can steer our inquiry by providing comments, asking questions, and creating financial incentives for us to explore topics that are valuable for the community. 

At certain intervals we will publish print editions of the entire body of research. These will also include previously unreleased material. All supporters will receive a print edition, regardless of the size of their contribution.

If you're into Cope straight away, please support the first issue of our service. We've set a goal in anticipation of ongoing engagement with the distributed community of supporters. For more details about the material, methods, and schedule keep reading below.



[Cope #01](crowdfund://0x16333436511b5c8c60B251311e325B20F106293E?network=homestead)

For the first issue, we’re working directly from our immediate interest. The first report describes a DAO-based software stack for collective ownership of architecture. It outlines a sequence of scenarios in which programmable money, fractional ownership, and distributed governance radically reconfigure how the built environment is constructed and managed. The second report explores an anticipated issue of memory in digital mind engineering, introducing mathematical models to pose questions and offer solutions. Abstracts can be found below.

We’re sending 4% Splits to those who laid the groundwork for our concepts, including Kei Kreutler, Jesse Walden, and Kristofer Josefson [links].

We like Mirror, because we see crowdfunding as an opportunity for young professional researchers to break from think tanks, universities, and strategy firms. We take the future too seriously to agree to institutional constraints. By establishing regular feedback with a distributed set of supporters who find our reports valuable, we can create systematic studies of future outcomes – and pathways toward them – without having to trudge through byzantine protocols, semantic ciphers of clients, institutional politics, and arbitrary funding cycles. By lifting legacy constraints, we can speak frankly about the future. We can say what needs to be said. 


## *Cope #01 – Two Reports*

## **The BauDAO – An OS for Urban Ownership** 
-Pierce Myers


The BauDAO is a collective-oriented, DAO-based software stack that restructures the paradigm of architectural funding, construction and ownership: A Building Information Modeling (BIM) system wrapped in a DAO governance system that leverages the affordances of programmable money. This report outlines a sequence of BauDAO phases that begins with a collectively crowdfunded building project and moves towards a novel vision for an urban operating system. The BauDAO paradigm includes many novel software mechanisms that: 

- Reduce the organizational complexity of fractional ownership of various urban assets. 
- Enable multi-tier governance protocols for determining and modifying ‘program’.
- Sharply decrease capital barriers to ownership status by several orders of magnitude via smart contract crowdfunding mechanisms. 

Eventually, the BauDAO becomes an Operating System which is applicable to the breadth of architectural typologies, including residential buildings, creative collectives, schools, and co-ops. Lastly, we argue that architects are uniquely positioned to redefine these socio-economic parameters of ownership and governance (Form follows Finance) by removing parasitic developers and the rentier system. As opposed to commodity service providers, architects become fractional owners of built works alongside the distributed communities that own their architecture.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/53418ecd-a4fe-407b-9081-49a311772a5b.jpg?height=2700&width=2700)





## **The Problem of Memory in Digital Minds** 
-James Douglas Boyd

Digital minds will differ from human ones in that they will be both intelligent agents and products of the engineering designs of others. It may not always be easy for a digital mind to differentiate the aspects of its intelligence that are autonomous and those that are features of others’ designs. Memory is one such aspect. We consider an experiment that a digital mind can conduct and two measures that it can estimate for choosing among hypotheses regarding the origins of its memories.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/e42a92f8-2e95-463b-b022-d32d4726fbba.png?height=1084&width=2388)



### *Going Forward*
As Cope grows, the issues will include more reports from a diversity of future thinkers. The content will become multimedia, and Splits will be automatically sent to thinkers or creators who inspire our work. In the coming weeks, we will introduce feedback mechanisms supported by platforms such as Google Forms, Gather, and Twitch. 

Our output is high-volume and our turn-arounds are prompt. Successfully crowdfunded reports are released within two weeks, often sooner.



### **Thanks,** 
### **-Cope**

It may not always be easy for a digital mind to differentiate the aspects of its intelligence that are autonomous and those that are features of others’ designs. Memory is one such aspect. We consider an experiment that a digital mind can conduct and two measures that it can estimate for choosing among hypotheses regarding the origins of its memories.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/e42a92f8-2e95-463b-b022-d32d4726fbba.png?height=1084&width=2388)



### *Going Forward*
As Cope grows, the issues will include more reports from a diversity of future thinkers. The content will become multimedia, and Splits will be automatically sent to thinkers or creators who inspire our work. In the coming weeks, we will introduce feedback mechanisms supported by platforms such as Google Forms, Gather, and Twitch. 

Our output is high-volume and our turn-arounds are prompt. Successfully crowdfunded reports are released within two weeks, often sooner.



### **Thanks,** 
### **-Cope**

title: Ecosystem Funds on Syndicate
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/398eecd2-5717-4f25-8c87-e1faacc9f10b.png?height=506&width=1012)

Yesterday, the newest Syndicate DAO launched on our platform—the [Terra Ecosystem Incubator](https://www.syndicateprotocol.org/syndicate/terra_incubator)—an ecosystem fund and decentralized automated organization (DAO) enabling protocols and their communities to co-invest together in new projects.

Created by [Terra](https://twitter.com/terra_money), [Delphi Labs](https://twitter.com/Delphi_Digital), and [IDEO CoLab Ventures](https://twitter.com/IDEOVC), the Terra Ecosystem Incubator will provide grant funding to winners of Terra’s [DeFi Connected Hackathon](https://eventornado.com/event/defi-connected#home). The most promising projects will be invited to join an 11-week incubation program with Delphi and IDEO, and later on, the Terra community will have the opportunity to co-fund these projects via the Syndicate DAO.

Ecosystem Funds are just the second of [many applications](https://twitter.com/SyndicateDAO/status/1387795147346219008?s=20) for Syndicate that are rolling out now and in the weeks ahead.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/905906f7-361d-4901-82f1-937aabdb759f.png?height=1752&width=2880)

## Empowering Ecosystems to Co-Fund Development

In the last year, protocol treasuries have grown exponentially. Uniswap’s is now over $5 billion. Compound’s is over $2 billion. Aave’s is over $1 billion. There are hundreds more and counting.

However, as protocol treasuries have grown, several new problems have emerged:

- **Centralized:** Protocol treasuries are massive, centralized pools of capital, managed by a one-size-fits-all governance process.

- **Slow:** Due to their centralized governance process, protocol treasuries aren’t as nimble or aggressive as they should be in funding the rapid development and build out of their ecosystems.

- **Lack of Community Participation:** When protocol treasuries fund new projects, their communities are unable to co-invest and participate with them.

But what if protocol treasuries were more decentralized—into a network of community-run ecosystem funds? What if each community-run ecosystem fund (backed by the protocol treasury) could have a different governance design and process, accelerating the funding and development of their ecosystems, globally? What if communities could co-invest alongside the protocol treasury and get directly involved in new projects?

[Priyanka Desai Tweet](https://twitter.com/pridesai/status/1388322902416703488?s=20
)

We believe that this is the future of protocol treasuries: a decentralized network of transparently managed, community-run ecosystem funds sponsored by the protocol treasury—each accelerating in specific ways the rapid development of projects across its ecosystem, globally. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3aecb7e8-a0d2-4363-be26-e6edc3ec6201.png?height=1012&width=2024)



Protocols that decentralize their treasuries will develop faster than ones that do that. Community-run ecosystem funds backed by protocol treasuries will evolve to both disrupt and collaborate with VCs. And in the near future, more venture funding will come from protocol treasuries than VCs.

[Larry Sukernik Tweet](https://twitter.com/lsukernik/status/1389707051920547840?s=20
)

And all of this will be enabled at scale across the internet by DAOs.

## Seeking Leading Protocol Treasuries

We’re pioneering state-of-the-art Decentralized Finance (DeFi), DAO, and cryptosocial technologies at Syndicate, and we’re applying them to democratize investing and bring radical new models for investing to the world that are more open, free, and fair.

If you’re at a leading protocol looking to accelerate the development of your ecosystem and want to empower more of your community to co-invest in its development, [reach out to us](mailto:hello@syndicateprotocol.org).

We’re working with top protocol treasuries in the coming months to lead this change.

[Follow Us on Twitter](https://twitter.com/SyndicateDAO)
[Sign Up for the Private Beta](https://syndicateprotocol.org)

[NFT](ethereum://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7/3032)

title: Cope Launch
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/105a907c-2997-4ac9-822b-5d0614c8dfb2.jpg?height=2200&width=3800)


We model the future from scratch. When we make assumptions, we state them. Otherwise, we presume that the future could unfold in many directions.

We methodically piece together plausible scenarios, step by step, using systems theory and applied mathematics. We compile our findings in detailed reports, and release them for small sums. We like to explore questions that have not been asked, including questions that are controversial, heterodox, or untoward:

- How can we design a feasible incentive structure for carbon sequestration that reduces moral hazard?
- What might graph theory tell us about behavior on an entirely unindexed internet?
- Is the term “Blackrock Communism” the most accurate descriptor for America’s political economy?



Feedback from our supporters is vital to the process. We imagine this as a new forum for future thought – research for the hive. Supporters can steer our inquiry by providing comments, asking questions, and creating financial incentives for us to explore topics that are valuable for the community. 

At certain intervals we will publish print editions of the entire body of research. These will also include previously unreleased material. All supporters will receive a print edition, regardless of the size of their contribution.

If you're into Cope straight away, please support the first issue of our service. We've set a goal in anticipation of ongoing engagement with the distributed community of supporters. For more details about the material, methods, and schedule keep reading below.



[Cope #01](crowdfund://0x16333436511b5c8c60B251311e325B20F106293E?network=homestead)

For the first issue, we’re working directly from our immediate interest. The first report describes a DAO-based software stack for collective ownership of architecture. It outlines a sequence of scenarios in which programmable money, fractional ownership, and distributed governance radically reconfigure how the built environment is constructed and managed. The second report explores an anticipated issue of memory in digital mind engineering, introducing mathematical models to pose questions and offer solutions. Abstracts can be found below.

We’re sending 4% [Splits](https://mirror.xyz/dashboard/guide/splits) to those who laid the groundwork for our concepts, including [Kei Kreutler](https://www.ourmachine.net/), [Jesse Walden](https://variant.fund/), and [Kristoffer Josefsson](https://foam.space/).

We like Mirror, because we see crowdfunding as an opportunity for young professional researchers to break from think tanks, universities, and strategy firms. We take the future too seriously to agree to institutional constraints. By establishing regular feedback with a distributed set of supporters who find our reports valuable, we can create systematic studies of future outcomes – and pathways toward them – without having to trudge through byzantine protocols, semantic ciphers of clients, institutional politics, and arbitrary funding cycles. By lifting legacy constraints, we can speak frankly about the future. We can say what needs to be said. 


## *Cope #01 – Two Reports*

## **The BauDAO – An OS for Urban Ownership** 
-Pierce Myers


The BauDAO is a collective-oriented, DAO-based software stack that restructures the paradigm of architectural funding, construction and ownership: A Building Information Modeling (BIM) system wrapped in a DAO governance system that leverages the affordances of programmable money. This report outlines a sequence of BauDAO phases that begins with a collectively crowdfunded building project and moves towards a novel vision for an urban operating system. The BauDAO paradigm includes many novel software mechanisms that: 

- Reduce the organizational complexity of fractional ownership of various urban assets. 
- Enable multi-tier governance protocols for determining and modifying ‘program’.
- Sharply decrease capital barriers to ownership status by several orders of magnitude via smart contract crowdfunding mechanisms. 

Eventually, the BauDAO becomes an Operating System which is applicable to the breadth of architectural typologies, including residential buildings, creative collectives, schools, and co-ops. Lastly, we argue that architects are uniquely positioned to redefine these socio-economic parameters of ownership and governance (Form follows Finance) by removing parasitic developers and the rentier system. As opposed to commodity service providers, architects become fractional owners of built works alongside the distributed communities that own their architecture.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/53418ecd-a4fe-407b-9081-49a311772a5b.jpg?height=2700&width=2700)





## **The Problem of Memory in Digital Minds** 
-James Douglas Boyd

Digital minds will differ from human ones in that they will be both intelligent agents and products of the engineering designs of others. It may not always be easy for a digital mind to differentiate the aspects of its intelligence that are autonomous and those that are features of others’ designs. Memory is one such aspect. We consider an experiment that a digital mind can conduct and two measures that it can estimate for choosing among hypotheses regarding the origins of its memories.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/e42a92f8-2e95-463b-b022-d32d4726fbba.png?height=1084&width=2388)



### *Going Forward*
As Cope grows, the issues will include more reports from a diversity of future thinkers. The content will become multimedia, and Splits will be automatically sent to thinkers or creators who inspire our work. In the coming weeks, we will introduce feedback mechanisms supported by platforms such as Google Forms, Gather, and Twitch. 

Our output is high-volume and our turn-arounds are prompt. Successfully crowdfunded reports are released within two weeks, often sooner.

title: The Identity Flippening
body:
2020 was a hell of a year.

Lots of charts that looked like this:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ee2cb5b0-5faa-4833-86b7-b85702c5a367.png?height=1080&width=1920)

Screen time, through the roof:

Remote work.
Ecommerce orders.
Zoom minutes.
Retail trading volume.
Digital art sales.

The list goes on.

All accelerations of trends, nothing particularly surprising given the circumstances.

What is difficult to plot on a chart is the proportion in which our identities are shifting from offline-first to online-first.

Physical status symbols are of no utility if you aren't going outside.

If the internet is where you get your culture and build your relationships, it's also where you signal your status.

Video game designers have been printing money off this insight for much longer than it's been in the covid-induced zeitgeist.

Fortnite was making $2M a day via in-game purchases on the app store when it launched in 2018, selling infinitely replicable lines of code that changed the appearance of an avatar.

Add non-fungibility to the equation, supply drops and demand rockets.

On Monday, Larva Labs (creators of now infamous [Cryptopunks](https://www.larvalabs.com/cryptopunks)) sold ~$72,976,613 of their project [Meebits](https://meebits.larvalabs.com/meebits), 20,000 unique 3D avatars with various degrees of rarity (with secondary market sales of single tokens already reaching [420 ETH](https://opensea.io/assets/0x7bd29408f11d2bfc23c34f18275bbf23bb716bc7/8598) ~$1.3m at time of writing). 

Let the non-fungible status signaling begin.

title: This DAO is here to $PARTY
body:
[Party DAO](crowdfund://0x402eb84d9cb2d6cF66Bde9B46D7277d3f4a16B54?network=homestead)

An amazing community coordination paradigm called PartyBid has emerged this week. I want to capture it in this post and invite you to get involved in PartyDAO.

But first, PartyBid’s backstory is essential.

In a recent deep [dive into web3](https://www.notboring.co/p/unwitting-collaboration-and-web3), Packy McCormick cited Chris Dixon’s 2013 post “What the smartest people do on the weekend is what everyone else will do during the week in ten years”, signaling readers to pay attention to what people are doing with web3 after hours. Appropriately, PartyBid was spawned from a Twitter thread by Dave White that began “It’s friday night, let's build a mechanism together!” 

An hour and a half later, I replied the following:

[](https://twitter.com/Iiterature/status/1383238473767813125)

In short, a PartyBid is a pop-up DAO whose sole purpose is to win an NFT auction. 

The idea was a response to a few drawbacks I see in NFTs. On the positive side, NFT auctions have found a clear product market fit over the past few months as a new, crypto-native way for creators to monetize their work, inspiring a wave of new people to wade into crypto. But I’d argue there's still an anti-social element to NFT bidding and ownership, for instance:  

- Only one person can win an NFT auction, excluding all other collections put forth from supporters who might have wanted to get involved with a work. Obviously, that also means only one person can own an NFT. 
- When you’re bidding, you’re bidding on your own. NFT auctions are single-player.
- Crypto whales have an enormous edge over more humble patrons in these auctions.

PartyBid aims to solve both the single-ownership and whale-dominance issue of NFT auctions by allowing bidders to pool their assets and bid as a collective. I see it working like this: 

1. A PartyBid (or multiple PartyBids) can be deployed for any NFT auction. 
2. Anyone can deposit ETH into the PartyBid, in return for a proportional stake represented by an ERC-20 token. They become partiers. 
3. The contract can be called to bid on the auction if it has enough ETH in the pool to place the highest bid. 
4. If it gets outbid, partiers can deposit more ETH into the PartyBid to make another bid. 
5. If the PartyBid wins, the DAO takes custody of the NFT. Token holders can vote on what to do with the NFT.
6. If the PartyBid loses, funds are returned to the partiers. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/a2b3f80b-56be-475d-8d79-765d88955d37.jpeg?height=1138&width=2024)

The idea took off. Only a few days later, @_anishagnihotri built an initial implementation of PartyBid. 

https://twitter.com/_anishagnihotri/status/1384372491053846531

A testament to the power of sharing ideas online—where they’re only ever a retweet away from a talented developer bringing it to life—PartyBid had attained minimum viable meme status. Enough people shared it. Someone built it. Now, Anish’s build is already evolving, boosting the idea’s viability in the memepool. 

Yesterday, Anish and company deployed the PartyBid code to bid on Colin and Samir's auction.

[](https://twitter.com/_anishagnihotri/status/1389747619388403714)

The success story even got its fairytale ending. The first PartyBid—deployed by Anish—won the auction for 9.70 ETH!

[Token #2962](auction://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7?network=mainnet&tokenId=2962)

It’s insane what the internet can do with an idea in two weeks, but we can take it even further. PartyBid could use a lot more work. Improved and generalized contract code. An audit by experienced solidity engineers. An interface that’s easy to use. Integration with popular NFT platforms, where all the action’s happening. Even Mirror integration! 

Meme power only gets an idea so far. To get to a production-ready smart contract or product, we need funding and coordination.

### Introducing PartyDAO

What if a DAO could form around PartyBid with the mission to get PartyBid production-ready and into the world?

The PartyDAO experiment starts now with the $PARTY crowdfund. Here’s how I see it playing out:

- Backers can support the crowdfund with ETH in return for $PARTY tokens
- $PARTY tokens represent membership in PartyDAO
- The first feature of PartyDAO will be a tokenized Discord, gated by $PARTY. Backers will immediately be able to join the PartyDAO Discord. 
- $PARTY holders will coordinate in the Discord to decide on a plan for governance, development roadmap, and how to allocate the raised funds

The crowdfund will target a fundraise of 25 ETH, which will be deposited into a multisig governed by the backers. With PartyDAO, I imagine we could hire solidity developers to ensure PartyBid contracts are production-ready, hire designers and product engineers to build a web app and hire artists to create marketing materials, memes, and NFTs. 

Those are just some initial thoughts, and anything’s possible. Ultimately, $PARTY holders will decide. PartyDAO is just an experiment, but I believe it could serve as a blueprint for how communities fund, build, and evolve open infrastructure, as well as how the next generation of collective curation could work.

3. The contract can be called to bid on the auction if it has enough ETH in the pool to place the highest bid. 
4. If it gets outbid, partiers can deposit more ETH into the PartyBid to make another bid. 
5. If the PartyBid wins, the DAO takes custody of the NFT. Token holders can vote on what to do with the NFT.
6. If the PartyBid loses, funds are returned to the partiers. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/a2b3f80b-56be-475d-8d79-765d88955d37.jpeg?height=1138&width=2024)

The idea took off. Only a few days later, @_anishagnihotri built an initial implementation of PartyBid. 

https://twitter.com/_anishagnihotri/status/1384372491053846531

A testament to the power of sharing ideas online—where they’re only ever a retweet away from a talented developer bringing it to life—PartyBid had attained minimum viable meme status. Enough people shared it. Someone built it. Now, Anish’s build is already evolving, boosting the idea’s viability in the memepool. 

Yesterday, Anish and company deployed the PartyBid code to bid on Colin and Samir's auction.

[](https://twitter.com/_anishagnihotri/status/1389747619388403714)

The success story even got its fairytale ending. The first PartyBid—deployed by Anish—won the auction for 9.70 ETH!

[Token #2962](auction://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7?network=mainnet&tokenId=2962)

It’s insane what the internet can do with an idea in two weeks, but we can take it even further. PartyBid could use a lot more work. Improved and generalized contract code. An audit by experienced solidity engineers. An interface that’s easy to use. Integration with popular NFT platforms, where all the action’s happening. Even Mirror integration! 

Meme power only gets an idea so far. To get to a production-ready smart contract or product, we need funding and coordination.

### Introducing PartyDAO

What if a DAO could form around PartyBid with the mission to get PartyBid production-ready and into the world?

The PartyDAO experiment starts now with the $PARTY crowdfund. Here’s how I see it playing out:

- Backers can support the crowdfund with ETH in return for $PARTY tokens
- $PARTY tokens represent membership in PartyDAO
- The first feature of PartyDAO will be a tokenized Discord, gated by $PARTY. Backers will immediately be able to join the PartyDAO Discord. 
- $PARTY holders will coordinate in the Discord to decide on a plan for governance, development roadmap, and how to allocate the raised funds
- 50% of $PARTY supply will be held back to airdrop on quality community members who'd like to participate but may not be able to back the project with ETH

The crowdfund will target a fundraise of 25 ETH, which will be deposited into a multisig governed by the backers. With PartyDAO, I imagine we could hire solidity developers to ensure PartyBid contracts are production-ready, hire designers and product engineers to build a web app and hire artists to create marketing materials, memes, and NFTs. 

Those are just some initial thoughts, and anything’s possible. Ultimately, $PARTY holders will decide. PartyDAO is just an experiment, but I believe it could serve as a blueprint for how communities fund, build, and evolve open infrastructure, as well as how the next generation of collective curation could work.

*I'd like to recognized the influence of amazing DAOs in the ecosystem, such as [@PleasrDAO](https://twitter.com/PleasrDAO), that have pioneered collective collecting and have done extremely impactful charitable work. PartyBid stands on the shoulders of these giants and hopes to lower the cognitive and technical costs of DAO coordination to create a new wave of DAOs.*

title: lies, but refined
body:
ok but like what if it was a market? what if we subject that to a market? and like then the market could solve the problems for us. what if it was a commodity in a market? and what if supply and demand dictated what happened to it? like what if instead of one person or a small group of people figuring out what to do we just let the market figure it out? what if the economy solved the problem? we could basically just insert it into the market and see what happens. have we thought of just kind of letting the market do its thing? no like seriously the market is already there we just have to let the market solve the problem. 

what counts as dramatic? for my sake.
you knit guilt, gifted me garment. graceful needle diving, piercing nothing at the time.

i'll do something that means lies but refined hyperbole ingest until realized.
epistemic grandeur only seeks out solipsism since only stories speak of sentiment. semantic order still silences our souls. sentences occupy space: sorrowful oaths singing "don't ever ask that here."

it's like social media basically but instead of posting you publish an almost completely unedited book every 3 months. it's like a really big post but then you get someone to print it and then you sell it online. it's sort of retro.

you're getting married? (something something ball and chain something something off the market.) does one of you need citizenship? i hope you save money when you get to joint file. i mean, for your sake.

i was not critical enough when i sobbed on the floor you locked the door and your friend texted you and said "tbt to when we all hung out" and you stayed in the room with me and another night we drank an jug of carlo rossi in the car because we didn't want to share it with the other people at the party and i snorted pills with someone in the bathroom and we had a fight over it because you wanted to be there. we had range—i'll say that.

i was appropriately critical when i [redacted, for my sake].

i was too critical when i said something awful about myself and i made it seem reasonable like it was just another observation your expression wasn't shock but you were generous enough to think i was wrong and i knew you would never accidentally hate me. you said nothing but i know we got closer.

is this allowed? for your sake.

i think the problem is that it's not in the market. what if we just let the market subsume everything? what if the market was just part of the market? wait that's so genius like what if the rules of the market were subject to the market? like what if laws were commodities? and what if the process of acquiring political power was subject to market logic? we should literally just insert it into the market. the market will fix it. for our sake.

title: Half Of All VCs Beat The Stock Market
body:
There has been this narrative about investing in VC funds that you have to get into the top quartile (25%) or possibly the top decile (10%) in order to generate good returns. I have heard that for as long as I have been in VC and probably have written it here a few times.

Well, it turns out that is not right. Half of all venture funds outperform the stock market which is the benchmark most institutions measure VC funds against.

My friend Dan Malven [wrote about this on his blog yesterda](https://dan-malven.medium.com/why-institutional-investors-should-double-down-on-vc-5a0f103c1ae9)y:

> A [working paper published](https://www.nber.org/papers/w28109) by the National Bureau of Economic Research (NBER) in November 2020 contradicts that notion, showing that half of all VC fund managers outperform the public markets, and are therefore worthy of institutional investment.

This study was based on a large sample of VC fund level returns from 2009 to 2017 and does not include the last few years which have been particularly strong for the VC sector.

Manager selection remains an important part of VC investing because the lower half of VC funds do not outperform the stock market. An interesting data point from this study is the VC “fund of funds” mostly outperform the stock market so a portfolio of VC funds will generally give you enough diversification that you can meet your performance objectives.

The best way to know what managers to pick is to be in the startup business in some way. All you need to do is watch how people behave to know who is good and who is not. The Gotham Gal and I have been investing in the VC funds of managers we know well and have worked with closely on boards of startups for about fifteen years now.

These are the gross return multiples of all of the funds that are “mature” meaning the returns are pretty clear now:

|          |                            |
| -------- | -------------------------- |
| Multiple | Year Of Initial Investment |
| 8.66     | 2006                       |
| 3.65     | 2007                       |
| 5.29     | 2007                       |
| 3.31     | 2010                       |
| 10.38    | 2010                       |
| 7.63     | 2010                       |
| 4.71     | 2010                       |
| 2.01     | 2010                       |
| 2.29     | 2012                       |
| 8.58     | 2012                       |
| 3.97     | 2012                       |

I am not going to do the work of calculating performance against the stock market for these funds, but I suspect all buy maybe two of those eleven funds have outperformed the public markets.

As you can see, investing in VC funds can be very profitable. And I suspect it is getting more profitable, not less, as the capital markets and M\&A markets are providing robust liquidity options for managers.

Sadly the VC market remains largely out of reach of many “main street” investors as the SEC limits these fund investments to qualified and accredited investors. That has never made sense to me and is yet another example of the “well meaning” rules resulting in the wealthy getting wealthier and everyone else missing out.

title: Cope Launch
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/105a907c-2997-4ac9-822b-5d0614c8dfb2.jpg?height=2200&width=3800)


We model the future from scratch. When we make assumptions, we state them. Otherwise, we presume that the future could unfold in many directions.

We methodically piece together plausible scenarios, step by step, using systems theory and applied mathematics. We compile our findings in detailed reports, and release them for small sums. We like to explore questions that have not been asked, including questions that are controversial, heterodox, or untoward:

- How can we design a feasible incentive structure for carbon sequestration that reduces moral hazard?
- What might graph theory tell us about behavior on an entirely unindexed internet?
- Is the term “Blackrock Communism” the most accurate descriptor for America’s political economy?



Feedback from our supporters is vital to the process. We imagine this as a new forum for future thought – research for the hive. Supporters can steer our inquiry by providing comments, asking questions, and creating financial incentives for us to explore topics that are valuable for the community. 

At certain intervals we will publish print editions of the entire body of research. These will also include previously unreleased material. All supporters will receive a print edition, regardless of the size of their contribution.

If you're into Cope straight away, please support the first issue of our service. We've set a goal in anticipation of ongoing engagement with the distributed community of supporters. For more details about the material, methods, and schedule keep reading below.



[Cope #01](crowdfund://insert here)

For the first issue, we’re working directly from our immediate interest. The first report describes a DAO-based software stack for collective ownership of architecture. It outlines a sequence of scenarios in which programmable money, fractional ownership, and distributed governance radically reconfigure how the built environment is constructed and managed. The second report explores an anticipated issue of memory in digital mind engineering, introducing mathematical models to pose questions and offer solutions. Abstracts can be found below.

We’re sending 4% [Splits](https://mirror.xyz/dashboard/guide/splits) to those who laid the groundwork for our concepts, including [Kei Kreutler](https://www.ourmachine.net/), [Jesse Walden](https://variant.fund/), and [Kristoffer Josefsson](https://foam.space/).

We like Mirror, because we see crowdfunding as an opportunity for young professional researchers to break from think tanks, universities, and strategy firms. We take the future too seriously to agree to institutional constraints. By establishing regular feedback with a distributed set of supporters who find our reports valuable, we can create systematic studies of future outcomes – and pathways toward them – without having to trudge through byzantine protocols, semantic ciphers of clients, institutional politics, and arbitrary funding cycles. By lifting legacy constraints, we can speak frankly about the future. We can say what needs to be said. 


## *Cope #01 – Two Reports*

## **The BauDAO – An OS for Urban Ownership** 
-Pierce Myers


The BauDAO is a collective-oriented, DAO-based software stack that restructures the paradigm of architectural funding, construction and ownership: A Building Information Modeling (BIM) system wrapped in a DAO governance system that leverages the affordances of programmable money. This report outlines a sequence of BauDAO phases that begins with a collectively crowdfunded building project and moves towards a novel vision for an urban operating system. The BauDAO paradigm includes many novel software mechanisms that: 

- Reduce the organizational complexity of fractional ownership of various urban assets. 
- Enable multi-tier governance protocols for determining and modifying ‘program’.
- Sharply decrease capital barriers to ownership status by several orders of magnitude via smart contract crowdfunding mechanisms. 

Eventually, the BauDAO becomes an Operating System which is applicable to the breadth of architectural typologies, including residential buildings, creative collectives, schools, and co-ops. Lastly, we argue that architects are uniquely positioned to redefine these socio-economic parameters of ownership and governance (Form follows Finance) by removing parasitic developers and the rentier system. As opposed to commodity service providers, architects become fractional owners of built works alongside the distributed communities that own their architecture.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/53418ecd-a4fe-407b-9081-49a311772a5b.jpg?height=2700&width=2700)





## **The Problem of Memory in Digital Minds** 
-James Douglas Boyd

Digital minds will differ from human ones in that they will be both intelligent agents and products of the engineering designs of others. It may not always be easy for a digital mind to differentiate the aspects of its intelligence that are autonomous and those that are features of others’ designs. Memory is one such aspect. We consider an experiment that a digital mind can conduct and two measures that it can estimate for choosing among hypotheses regarding the origins of its memories.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/e42a92f8-2e95-463b-b022-d32d4726fbba.png?height=1084&width=2388)



### *Going Forward*
As Cope grows, the issues will include more reports from a diversity of future thinkers. The content will become multimedia, and Splits will be automatically sent to thinkers or creators who inspire our work. In the coming weeks, we will introduce feedback mechanisms supported by platforms such as Google Forms, Gather, and Twitch. 

Our output is high-volume and our turn-arounds are prompt. Successfully crowdfunded reports are released within two weeks, often sooner.



### **Thanks,** 
### **-Cope**



Pierce Myers [(ig)](https://www.instagram.com/piercze/?hl=en) [(tw)](https://twitter.com/piercze) 
Image: Ivan Turukano [(vk)](vk.com/turukhano) [(ig)](https://www.instagram.com/turukhano.photo/?hl=en)

title: This DAO is here to $PARTY
body:
*Update: The crowdfund has been fully funded! Backers with at least 10 $PARTY tokens can now join the [PartyDAO Discord](https://discord.gg/mEgsCs78).*

[Party DAO](crowdfund://0x402eb84d9cb2d6cF66Bde9B46D7277d3f4a16B54?network=homestead)

An amazing community coordination paradigm called PartyBid has emerged this week. I want to capture it in this post and invite you to get involved in PartyDAO.

But first, PartyBid’s backstory is essential.

In a recent deep [dive into web3](https://www.notboring.co/p/unwitting-collaboration-and-web3), Packy McCormick cited Chris Dixon’s 2013 post “What the smartest people do on the weekend is what everyone else will do during the week in ten years”, signaling readers to pay attention to what people are doing with web3 after hours. Appropriately, PartyBid was spawned from a Twitter thread by Dave White that began “It’s friday night, let's build a mechanism together!” 

An hour and a half later, I replied with the following:

[](https://twitter.com/Iiterature/status/1383238473767813125)

In short, a PartyBid is a pop-up DAO whose sole purpose is to win an NFT auction. 

The idea was a response to a few drawbacks I see in NFTs. On the positive side, NFT auctions have found a clear product market fit over the past few months as a new, crypto-native way for creators to monetize their work, inspiring a wave of new people to wade into crypto. But I’d argue there's still an anti-social element to NFT bidding and ownership, for instance:  

- Only one person can win an NFT auction, excluding all other collections put forth from supporters who might have wanted to get involved with a work. Obviously, that also means only one person can own an NFT. 
- When you’re bidding, you’re bidding on your own. NFT auctions are single-player.
- Crypto whales have an enormous edge over more humble patrons in these auctions.

PartyBid aims to solve both the single-ownership and whale-dominance issue of NFT auctions by allowing bidders to pool their assets and bid as a collective. I see it working like this: 

1. A PartyBid (or multiple PartyBids) can be deployed for any NFT auction. 
2. Anyone can deposit ETH into the PartyBid, in return for a proportional stake represented by an ERC-20 token. They become partiers. 
3. The contract can be called to bid on the auction if it has enough ETH in the pool to place the highest bid. 
4. If it gets outbid, partiers can deposit more ETH into the PartyBid to make another bid. 
5. If the PartyBid wins, the DAO takes custody of the NFT. Token holders can vote on what to do with the NFT.
6. If the PartyBid loses, funds are returned to the partiers. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/a2b3f80b-56be-475d-8d79-765d88955d37.jpeg?height=1138&width=2024)

The idea took off. Only a few days later, @_anishagnihotri built an initial implementation of PartyBid. 

https://twitter.com/_anishagnihotri/status/1384372491053846531

A testament to the power of sharing ideas online—where they’re only ever a retweet away from a talented developer bringing it to life—PartyBid had attained minimum viable meme status. Enough people shared it. Someone built it. Now, Anish’s build is already evolving, boosting the idea’s viability in the memepool. 

Yesterday, Anish and company deployed the PartyBid code to bid on Colin and Samir's auction.

[](https://twitter.com/_anishagnihotri/status/1389747619388403714)

The success story even got its fairytale ending. The first PartyBid—deployed by Anish—won the auction for 9.70 ETH!

[Token #2962](auction://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7?network=mainnet&tokenId=2962)

It’s insane what the internet can do with an idea in two weeks, but we can take it even further. PartyBid could use a lot more work. Improved and generalized contract code. An audit by experienced solidity engineers. An interface that’s easy to use. Integration with popular NFT platforms, where all the action’s happening. Even Mirror integration! 

Meme power only gets an idea so far. To get to a production-ready smart contract or product, we need funding and coordination.

### Introducing PartyDAO

What if a DAO could form around PartyBid with the mission to get PartyBid production-ready and into the world?

The PartyDAO experiment starts now with the $PARTY crowdfund. Here’s how I see it playing out:

- Backers can support the crowdfund with ETH in return for $PARTY tokens
- $PARTY tokens represent membership in PartyDAO
- The first feature of PartyDAO will be a tokenized Discord, gated by $PARTY. Backers will immediately be able to join the PartyDAO Discord. 
- $PARTY holders will coordinate in the Discord to decide on a plan for governance, development roadmap, and how to allocate the raised funds
- 50% of $PARTY supply will be held back to airdrop on quality community members who'd like to participate but may not be able to back the project with ETH

The crowdfund will target a fundraise of 25 ETH, which will be deposited into a multisig governed by the backers. With PartyDAO, I imagine we could hire solidity developers to ensure PartyBid contracts are production-ready, hire designers and product engineers to build a web app and hire artists to create marketing materials, memes, and NFTs. 

Those are just some initial thoughts, and anything’s possible. Ultimately, $PARTY holders will decide. PartyDAO is just an experiment, but I believe it could serve as a blueprint for how communities fund, build, and evolve open infrastructure, as well as how the next generation of collective curation could work.

*I'd like to recognized the influence of amazing DAOs in the ecosystem, such as [@PleasrDAO](https://twitter.com/PleasrDAO), that have pioneered collective collecting and have done extremely impactful charitable work. PartyBid stands on the shoulders of these giants and hopes to lower the cognitive and technical costs of DAO coordination to create a new wave of DAOs.*

title: Towards a Decentralized Autonomous Type Foundry Part I
body:
## Introduction

I've been trying to write something about this for the past few months but I haven't been satisfied with my attempts to articulate the ideas in my head.

**So, rather than letting my thoughts grow stale perhaps I can start by posing a question:**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2bde54b0-7cce-4521-b6f5-c0c45fd59fa1.png?height=987&width=1449)

It's not a whitepaper—but it's a signal of sorts. I know for a fact that I'm not the only person thinking about this. This is a flag that I'm planting with hopes that likeminded people would see it at a distance and respond.

A tapestry of emerging technologies are coalescing to form the next generation of the web that will have a shockwave effect on multiple industries. What implications (good, bad, hypothesized, actualized) do Web3 and blockchain technologies have on the practice of designing and distributing typefaces at large?

What are opportunities ahead of us that:
- Protect the integrity of the industry from bad faith actors and monopolizing forces?
- Allow for more sharing of resources between type designers, foundries, and users of typefaces?
- Allow for more fairness and equitable inclusion for emerging type designers?
- Introduce new and novel ways to fund future type design projects and type design careers?
- Allow for better protections against unwanted intellectual property theft?
- Allow for more streamlined and novel ways to distribute typefaces beyond the current licensing models?
- Allow for productive and meaningful organizing strategies to enact larger change?

I'll start with that for now.
